title: build command ignores --single-target
body:
### What happened?

**What happened**
I'm wanting to only build one target that doesn't get published. To do this, I'm using the following

```
GOOS=linux GOARCH=amd64 goreleaser build --clean --snapshot --single-target
```

My understanding is that this should clean out the dist folder and then build a single binary for linux amd64 without using a git tag. Instead, it's still building a binary for all platforms

```
  • starting build...
  • loading                                          path=.goreleaser.yaml
  • building only for linux/amd64                    reason=single target is enabled
  • skipping validate...
  • loading environment variables
  • getting and validating git state
    • ignoring errors because this is a snapshot     error=git doesn't contain any tags. Either add a tag or use --snapshot
    • git state                                      commit=d4b5de7509de37b868a8051e090fed22e5d1cbcf branch=CI current_tag=v0.0.0 previous_tag=<unknown> dirty=false
    • pipe skipped                                   reason=disabled during snapshot mode
  • parsing tag
  • setting defaults
  • snapshotting
    • building snapshot...                           version=0.0.0-d4b5de7
  • checking distribution directory
    • cleaning dist
  • loading go mod information
  • build prerequisites
  • writing effective config file
    • writing                                        config=dist/config.yaml
  • building binaries
    • building                                       binary=dist/windows_386/binary.exe
    • building                                       binary=dist/linux_amd64_v1/binary
    • building                                       binary=dist/linux_386/binary
    • building                                       binary=dist/linux_arm64/binary
    • building                                       binary=dist/darwin_amd64_v1/binary
    • building                                       binary=dist/darwin_arm64/binary
    • building                                       binary=dist/windows_arm64/binary.exe
    • building                                       binary=dist/windows_amd64_v1/binary.exe
```

**What I expected to happen**
Only the binary for linux amd64 should've been built

### How can we reproduce this?

I'm running ubuntu 22.04 and using goreleaser from snap. I use the following command

```
GOOS=linux GOARCH=amd64 goreleaser build --clean --snapshot --single-target
```

Ultimately, this will be running an ubuntu 22.04 image in CI which downloads goreleaser as part of a goreleaser action. I'm getting the same behavior in CI.

### goreleaser version

```bash
1.22.0

I just checked in CI and 1.21.2 works as expected
```
